defs: a contemptible, worthless thing.
to treat contemptuously; to belittle; to slight.
a piece of cloth or bunting, often attached to a staff, with distinctive colours, patterns or symbolic devices, used as a national or state symbol, as a signal, etc.; a banner.
a spurious, counterfeit pearl or diamond.
a pair of small, hollowed pieces of wood or ivory, with small jingling bells attached, held in the hand by a connecting cord clicked together with the fingers to beat time to music; castanets.
a removable top cover (as of a container); a lid.
a removing the pyramidal portion (of grains) over and above the brim level of a container or measure, while measuring.
the fastest gait of a horse or other animal, consisting of a succession of leaping strides with all the feet off the ground at one time; gallop.
a particular kind of wrestling.
= ಟೆಬ್ಬರ.
to run very fast; to go at a gallop.
the act or an instance (of a horse) going at a gallop.
the act of molesting, annoying; an inflicting of pain, trouble, etc.
to render a person, animal or thing weak or useless.
to inflict a wound or wounds.
to lose strength.
to have a strong dislike.
= ಟೆಲಿಗ್ರಾಮು.
a message or communication sent by telegraph; a telegraphic message.
= ಟೆಲಿಗ್ರಾಫು.
the plant Desmodium motorium (= D. gyrans) of Papilionaceae family, noted for the spontaneous, jerking, signal like motions of its leaflets; telegraph plant.
an old system that converts a coded message into electric impulses and sends it to a distant receiver; telegraph.

a system for transmitting speech or computerised information over distances, usu. by converting sounds into electric impulses that are sent through a network of wires and cables or by means of radio waves; telephone.
= ಟೆಲಿವಿಷನ್ನು.

television - a) the broadcasting of a still or moving image via radio waves to receivers that project a view of the image on a picture tube; b) the process involved; c) a set for receiving television broadcasts.
communication by electronic or electric means, as through radio, telephone, telegraph, television or computers; telecommunication.
an optical instrument, consisting of two or more lenses or mirrors, for making distant objects, as the stars, appear nearer and consequently larger; a telescope.
one of the sounds made by percussion instrument when played systematically.
overbearing pride or self-importance; haughty behaviour resulting from this; arrogance; undue pride.
a stroke with a finger on any percussion instrument while playing.
a slow measure in beating a percussion instrument.
ಟೇಕಾ ಹಾಕು tēkāhāku to play a percussion instrument rhythmically; ಟೇಕಾ ಹಿಡಿ tēkāhiḍi to get the rhythm while playing a percussion instrument.
a spurious, counterfeit pearl or diamond.
a device for recording on magnetic tape and for playing back what has been recorded.
the recording of electrical signals by means of changes in areas of magnetisation on a tape, wire or disc, used for recording sound, video material, etc.; magnetic recording.
the musical voice or sound.
a strong, narrow, woven strip of cotton, linen, etc. used to bind seams in garments, tie bundles, etc.; a tape.
a strip of cloth stretched between posts above the finishing line of a race.
a tape with marks in inches, feet, centimetres, meters, etc. for measuring: a measuring tape.
a thin plastic ribbon coated with a suspension of ferro-magnetic iron oxide particles, used as a storage medium for magnetic recording; a magnetic tape.
tape with a sticky substance on one side, variously used, as for holding bandages in place; an adhesive tape.
= ಟೈಪ್‍ರೈಟರು.
a machine for writing mechanically in letters and characters like those produced by printerś types; a typewriter.
a person who operates a typewriter, esp. one whose work is typing; a typist.

a type - a) a rectangular piece of metal with a raised letter, figure, etc. in reverse on its upper end, used in printing on paper or other material, as in a printing press or on a typewriter; b) a character or characters formed electronically and produced by a computer printer.
a symbol, token, sign etc.
a kind, class, etc. that is particular to a person, animal or thing.
ಟೈಪು ಮಾಡು type māḍu to write with a typewriter or computer; to type.

a ring or band of rubber, either solid or hollow placed over the rim of a wheel of a vehicle encasing a tube inflatable with air of specified pressure, that helps the vehicle to move smoothly; a tyre.
the part of the body between the ribs and the hips; the waist.
the part of a garment that covers the waist.
(fig.) to prepare oneself for (undertaking something); to be determinedly ready to do something.
to rest the body on the feet, bending at knees, and rise to erect position, keeping the palms on the flanks.
(dial.) to walk on a single foot; to limp.
to knock or strike gently.
to leap or jump.
any woody extension growing from the trunk or main stem of a tree; a branch.
uncleaned grains.
the outer covering of something the inner portion of which is weak, useless or sapless.
(fig.) a useless person.
the act of moving limpingly, as with a lame or partially disabled leg.
plump; fat; corpulent; obese; stout.
a fat, corpulent man.
a useless, bulky man; a lubber.
a stout, relatively short, piece of wood; a cudgel.
a stroke with a cudgel or its impact.
to give a sever beating to; to flog; to thrash.
to separate into parts as by piercing, cutting, etc.
to leave; to forsake; to desert.
to win victory over; to defeat; to overcome; to beat.
cheat; to defraud; to deceive.
to take or appropriate another's property, without permission or in a dishonest amd surreptitious manner.
having a corpulent body; bulky; lubberly.
a big, lubberly fellow; a hulk.
a corpulent, bulky woman.
a container made of thin flexible strips of bamboo; a basket.
a protective metal covering for the head; a helmet.

ಟೊಪ್ಪಿಗೆ ಬೀಳು toppige bīḷu = ಟೋಪಿ ಬೀಳು; ಟೊಪ್ಪಿಗೆ ಹಾಕು toppige hāku = ಟೋಪಿ ಹಾಕು; ಟೊಪ್ಪಿಗೆ ಹಾರಿಸು toppige hārisu to take off another cap, hat or other headgear; 2. (fig.) to show disrespect to; to act insolently.
a kind of insect.
the annual plant Lycopersicon lycopersicum (= L. esculentum) of Solanaceae family; tomato.
its red or yellowish berry with a juicy pulp, used as a vegetable; tomato fruit.
a tall basket used as a corn-storing bin.
the belly.
a cup made of a leaf or leaves, used for drinking liquids or as a container; a leaf-cup.
the shrubby plant Connarus monocarpus of Connaraceae family.
having an empty space or only air, within it; having a cavity inside; not solid; hollow.
that which is hollow, empty.
a hole or hollow place; cavity.
the hollow eye-socket.
a protuberant, huge belly.
(fig.) that which is without any worth or of no use, importance or value; a person who is utterly weak.
the grass Iseilema laxum of Poaceae family.
the gill of an aquatic animal; a branchia.
a blow or its impact.
an instance of cheating or being cheated.
a reduction (as in one's salary, wages, profit, business return etc.); lessening; decrease.
= ಟೋಕರ.
a container made of thin flexible strips of bamboo; a basket.
to furnish a text with glosses; to give an interpretation to a literary or philosophical work.
to analyse and judge as a critic; to evaluate.
to judge disapprovingly; to find fault with; to criticise; to censure.
more or less correct in number, volume, quantity, quality, etc.
(usu. said of selling, buying, etc.) in lot; in large quantity; wholesale.
(usu. said of selling, buying, etc.) a lot; large quantity.
the act, process of tallying something approximately.
an estimating the probable cost, value, expense, volume, etc.; a rough estimate.
the selling of goods in relatively large quantities at a lower rate and usu. at prices lower than at retail, esp. such selling to retailers being; for resale to consumers; wholesale.
= ಟೋಪನ್ನು.
a false covering of real or synthetic hair for the head, worn as part of a costume by stage actors or by men to conceal baldness, etc.; a wig.
= ಟೊಪಲೆ.
any close-fitting head covering, either brimless or with a projecting brim, and made of wool, cotton, etc.; a cap.
a covering for the face (usu. used to cover the face of rams brought for ram-fight).
ಟೋಪಿ ಬೀಳು ṭōpi bīḷu fig.) to be deceived, cheated; 2. (an instance of cheating) to happen; ಟೋಪಿ ಹಾಕು ṭōpi hāku (fig.) to deceive, cheat.
one who wears a cap.
an European or in gen. a man with white complexion.
a large, mounted piece of artillery for firing heavy projectiles; a cannon.
the pure silk textured border of a sīre (sari, the long, unsewn cloth worn by women).
= ಟೋಪನ್ನು.
= ಟೋಪನ್ನು.
a school where traditional scriptures are taught.
= ಟೋಲುಗೇಟು.
a tax or charge exacted by the state or local authorities for a privilege, esp. for permission to pass over a bridge, along a highway, etc.; toll.
a check-post where charges for passing a barrier or using a bridge or road etc. is collected; a toll-gate.
a group of persons, forming a recognisable unit.
a military unit; a regiment or battalion.
to form a group; to assemble in large numbers at a place.
lack of honesty; a disposition to lie, cheat or steal; deceiving; dishonesty.
a false statement made with deliberate intent to deceive; an intentional untruth; a falsehood; a lie.
the feeling, attitude or expression of disdaining; the feeling of contempt.
a man who habitually cheats another; a fraud or cheat.
a protective covering for the head used by soldiers; a helmet.
a steel covering worn to protect the body against weapons; an armour.
= ಟೌಳಿ1 - 4; 2.(masc.) an expert in magic; a performer skilled in sleight of hand, illusions, etc.
the act, habit of cheating; the quality of a deceitful person.
any large container for liquid or gas; a tank.
a heavily armoured, self-propelled combat vehicle armed with cannon and machine guns and moving on full tractor treads; a military tank.
a motor car, usu. fitted with a taximeter, licensed to ply for hire.
a hollow cylinder or pipe of metal, glass, rubber, etc., usu. long in proportion to its diameter, used for conveying fluids, etc.; a tube.
a cylindrical, circular, inflatable casing, fitted, inside a tyre, to the wheel of a vehicle, for smooth movement and carrying load.
a small, collapsible, cylinder of metal or plastic sealed at one end and having a capped opening at the other from which paint, toothpaste or some other semifluid substance may be squeezed.
a train that runs in a tubular tunnel; a tube-train.

a tubular glass lamp coated on the inside with a fluorescent substance that gives off light when mercury vapour in the tube is acted upon by a stream of electrons from the cathode; a fluorescent lamp.
a large, portable box, made usu. of steel sheets, with a lid attached; a trunk.
an automotive, heavy vehicle for transporting loads along highways, streets, etc.; a truck.
a firm belief or confidence in the honesty, integrity, reliability, justice, etc. of another person or thing; faith; trust.
something entrusted to one; charge, duty, etc.
a person, group of persons or an organisation that has been given nominal ownership of property which is to be kept, used or administered for another's benefit; a trust.
a handy radio receiver set equipped with or transistors; a transistorised radio.
a small passenger-train that runs through a city on rails; a tram-car.
a flat shallow vessel, made of wood, metal, etc., usu. with a raised, rim for carrying dishes etc., displaying articles or holding small articles, papers, etc.; a tray.
a line of connected cars pulled or pushed by a locomotive on a specially laid down rail-track; a train.
(gen. pronounced with the vowel 'ಅ') the twenty-sixth letter of Kannaḍa alphabet and the twelfth consonant.
a symbol for the number two.
the act or process of minting monetary coins.
to pluck the string of a bow and produce a heavy sound.
a place where money is coined by authority of the government; a mint.
the heavy sound produced by pulling and releasing suddenly the string of a bow.

to spread a gossip, information news, etc. widely.
= ಡಂಗುರಹೊಡೆ.
to cause or order (someone) to announce something in public over a wide area, beating a drum.
= ಡಂಗುರಹೊಯಿಸು.
= ಡಂಗುರಕಾರ.
= ಡಂಗುರಹೊಡೆ.
a game in which one seeks the others who have hidden themselves; hide-and-seek.
= ಡಂಗುರ.
a thick, usu. bottle-shaped club of metal, used as a weapon.
to take up a cudgel; to ready oneself to fight (with).
to be doggedly persisting (as in demanding for something); to demand obstinately.
= ಡಂಗುರ.
